gov.usgs.traveltime

Class BrnDataVol

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.traveltime.BrnDataVol

  • public class BrnDataVol
extends java.lang.Object
    Generate all volatile information associated with one travel-time branch.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

    • Constructor Summary

      BrnDataVol(BrnDataRef ref, UpDataVol pUp, UpDataVol sUp, ModConvert cvt, Spline spline)
      Set up volatile copies of data that changes with depth

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrnDataVol

        public BrnDataVol(BrnDataRef ref,
                  UpDataVol pUp,
                  UpDataVol sUp,
                  ModConvert cvt,
                  Spline spline)
        Set up volatile copies of data that changes with depth
        Parameters:
        ref - The branch reference data source
        pUp - The corrected P up-going branch source
        sUp - The corrected S up-going branch source
        cvt - The conversion factor object

    • Method Detail

      • depthCorr

        public void depthCorr(double zSource,
                      double dTdDepth,
                      double xMin,
                      char tagBrn)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Correct this branch for source depth using the corrected up-going branch ray parameters and tau values.
        Parameters:
        dTdDepth - Correction factor for dT/dDepth
        xMin - The minimum source-receiver distance desired between ray parameter samples
        tagBrn - The P or S up-going branch suffix
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the tau integral fails

      • getTT

        public void getTT(int depIndex,
                  double xs,
                  double dSource,
                  boolean useful,
                  TTime ttList)
        Get the travel times for this branch. Three different distances must to be processed, but this needs to be driven from AllBrnVol so that the surface focus distance correction can be applied for the auxiliary data, hence the need for depIndex.
        Parameters:
        depIndex - Depth index (there are three possible depths)
        xs - Desired distance in radians
        dSource - Source depth in kilometers
        useful - If true only return potentially useful phases
        ttList - A list of travel times to be filled in

      • oneRay

        public double oneRay(double dTdD)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the surface focus source-receiver distance and travel time. Note that for up-going branches the calculation is from the source depth.
        Parameters:
        dTdD - Desired ray parameter in seconds/degree
        Returns:
        Source-receiver distance in degrees
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the desired arrival doesn't exist

      • getTimeCorr

        public double getTimeCorr()
        Getter for the travel time computed by the last call to oneRay.
        Returns:
        Travel-time in seconds

      • setCompute

        public void setCompute(boolean compute)
        Setter for the branch compute flag. Branches can be requested through the desired phase list. The branch flags will need to be reset for each new session.
        Parameters:
        compute - If true compute travel times from this branch

      • getPhSeg

        public java.lang.String getPhSeg()
        Get the branch segment code.
        Returns:
        Branch segment code

      • dumpBrn

        public void dumpBrn(boolean full,
                    boolean all,
                    boolean sci,
                    boolean useful)
        Print out branch information for debugging purposes. Note that this partly duplicates the print function in AllBrnRef, but includes volatile data as well.
        Parameters:
        full - If true, print the branch specification as well
        all - If true, print even more specifications
        sci - If true, print using scientific notation
        useful - If true, omit "useless" crustal phases

      • forTable

        public void forTable(boolean useful)
        Generate one line of a branch summary table.
        Parameters:
        useful - If true, omit "useless" crustal phases
